item.title: Why Your 'Perfect' Team Is Actually Falling Apart: Communication Matters
item.description: Messages carry feelings we often miss. When teammates don't understand each other, it hurts more than the work. It breaks trust. See why short messages seem angry, silence feels like disagreement, and confusion turns to blame. Simple fixes for the hidden problems that pull teams apart.

item.title: Another look into PostgreSQL CTE materialization and non-idempotent subqueries
item.description: A follow-up exploration into PostgreSQL CTE materialization, diving deeper into why non-idempotent subqueries can execute multiple times, leading to unexpected results.

item.title: Hyperparameter Tuning is just a Resource Scheduling Problem
item.description: When you hear hyperparameter tuning, you might think of trying lots of different model settings to find the best one‚Äîmaybe using grid search, random search, or some fancy algorithm. But when you‚Äôre doing this at scale, especially with limited time or compute, it‚Äôs not just about finding the best settings. It‚Äôs about how you manage your resources. You have a bunch of models to try, but you can‚Äôt run them all fully.

item.title: Two Years Building a Startup ‚Äì Sebastian Hooker
item.description: I left my career in big tech in July of 2023 to try my hand at entrepreneurship. I had just turned 31 and figured if I didn‚Äôt take the chance now, I was probably never going to. On a risk-adjusted basis, it‚Äôs been a horrible financial decision. However, it‚Äôs also been the most professionally fulfilled I‚Äôve ever been in my life, and if we succeed in executing on our vision, the financial payoff could make it even better.
